title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: It had a dead short to ground  at c7804 which is pp3v3_g3h_pmu_vddmain.  I injected 3 volts to find it.  now pp1v8_slps2r is 0v.  do i need to replace to capacitor or no?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message:
Board should start without it.
However, I recommend to solder another cap, once you get the board working.

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: pp3v3_g3h is fluctuating quickly from 2.5v to 3.1v. could that be why pp1v8_slps2r isn't there?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: replaced q7680 and it boots fine now

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: could the usb-c ribbon cause pp3v3_g3h to fluctuate?  the rail shorted again and had the replace q7680. now pp3v3_g3h fluctuates sporadically from 2.0v to 3.1v.  could this be a ribbon issue?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: You can discard testing with known good one...

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: could the pmic cause the 3v3_g3h rail to fluctuate like that?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message:
Still missing 1V8_SLPS2R?
PPBUS_G3H and 3V3_G3H_RTC are stable?

Inspect for corrosion between U7650 and Q7680.
Pay atention to R7691/97/98/99.
Also check R7685 and C7689.

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: the 3v3_g3h rail became stable but then after running the configurator i started getting 6.8 volts on 3v3_g3h afterwards .  i get 3.3v without u7650 on the board  and 20v on the amp meter. how is this possible without u7650 on the board?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message:
Did you apply power without U7650, but Q7660/80 soldered on the board???
You are very lucky if none of them got burnt.
Do NOT do that again ever in your life!!!

Did you check all above mentioned?
Is the board still booting?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: no it doesn't boot. u7800 was shorting the 3v3_g3h rail and was removed.  Does the u7800 have to be there for 3v3_g3h to work?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message:
Oops...
U7800 is the PMU chip (Power Management Unit).
It provides basic voltages to T2.

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: i'm getting no voltage for 3v3_g3h and it isn't shorted. does that mean that u7560 needs replacing?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: Did you even check if U7650 gets correct power and enable signal?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: i checked the circuit and it's just not producing 3v3_g3h. i don't want to put on a new PMIC until i get that rail working. do you know where i can get a new tps51980b?

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message:
Be sure to use TPS51980B there; NOT the A version.

On this board 3V3_G3H enable input is left floating.
All other boards where TPS51980A is specified, enable signal is driven high to enable it.

title: pp1v8_slps2r is missing on 820-01958
message: ok thank you. I'll need to hunt down the correct chip
